page.title: 03Hereford. A Domesday Farm.
page.content: HEREFORD DOMESDAY FARM REVISITED. {1085 A.D.}"In Werham funt ii hidae 7 dimid. geld.Ibi.viii vitti cu.iiii. car. Val 7 valuit xxx folid." "In Warham two and a half hides which pay tax.Eight villagers with four ploughs. The value is and was 30s." {1985 A.D.}Warham Court Farm is owned by the Church of England and farmed by Mr.Newcomb.The oldest building is 14th century.Six hundred acres (250 hect.) produce mostly grass for silage and grazing for 150 cows giving 3500l.milk daily.In 13 acres of orchard are grown apples and pears for cider and perry.A little wheat and barley is grown for fodder.There are 3 farmworkers, 6 tractors, 1 combine-harvester and this modern farmer uses a motorbike to round up the cows!
